intro: Stenandriopsis grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered stenandriopsis, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its ornamental foliage and showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a glossy surface, while its flowers are clustered in umbels and display shades of white and pink. It is often cultivated for its aesthetic value in gardens and greenhouses.
